TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Fine-loamy, mixed, superactive, mesic Fluventic Haplustolls

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Prewitt clay loam.
Ap--0 to 4 inches; reddish brown (5YR 4/33 clay loam, dark reddish brown (5YR 3/3) moist; weak to moderate fine granular structure; calcareous; clear smooth boundary.
AC--4 to 14 inches; dark reddish gray (5YR 4/2) clay loam, dark reddish gray (5YR 3/2) moist; weak medium subangular blocky structure breaking to medium granular peds under pressure; hard, friable; calcareous; clear smooth boundary.
C--14 to 50 + inches; reddish gray (5YR 5/2) stratified clay loam and silty clay loam, with some very fine sandy loam, dark reddish gray (5YR 4/2) moist; massive; hard, friable; calcareous.

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Valencia County, New Mexico, NE1/4 SE1/4 SW1/4 Sec. 15 T.12N, R. 11.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content: RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  Although strata of coarser and finer materials are nearly always present in the subsoil it is predominantly moderately fine textured.  Salt content of the lower subsoil horizons ranges from none to moderate, and some salt may occur at any depth.  Color of the A horizon may range in hue from 2.5YR to 7.5YR, in chroma from 1.5 to 3, and in value from 4 to 5.5.  Color values of the moist A horizon range from 2 to 3.5.  Hue of the C horizon may range from 2.5YR to 2.5Y with hues as red or redder than 7.5YR predominating.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Nearly level to gently sloping flood plains and low terraces.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY: Well drained. Infiltration and permeability are moderately slow.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  Large acreages of this soil are under irrigation and used for truck crops.  Short grass in areas of native range.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  Western New Mexico and probably western Colorado, Wyoming, and Utah.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Phoenix, Arizona

ORIGIN.content:
SERIES ESTABLISHED:  Valencia County (Bluewater Area); New Mexico, 1958.   Series name is from Prewitt, New Mexico.
OSED scanned by SSQA.  Last revised by state on 1/61.
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U.S.A.
